etymology.description: 起(起) (qǐ, "rise") + 义(義) (yì, "righteous") = rise in the name of righteousness; insurrection
etymology.interpretation: The word 起义(起義) (qǐyì, "rise in righteousness") signifies the act of rising up or an insurrection for a moral or just cause. Historically, it has been used to describe rebellions or uprisings against unjust rule or tyranny, emphasizing the moral justification behind such actions.

examples.chinese: 农民起义(農民起義)，掀起了革命浪潮(掀起了革命浪潮)。
examples.english: The peasant uprising unleashed a revolutionary tide.

examples.chinese: 英雄为了正义起义(英雄為了正義起義)，保卫国家(保衛國家)。
examples.pinyin: Yīngxióng wèile zhèngyì qǐyì, bǎowèi guójiā.
examples.english: Heroes rose up for righteousness to defend the country.

examples.chinese: 起义声震寰宇(起義聲震寰宇)，鼓舞了民心(鼓舞了民心)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐyì shēng zhèn huányǔ, gǔwǔle mínxīn.
examples.english: The sound of the uprising shook the universe and inspired the people's hearts.
